In connection with possible operations in the Persian Gulf, it is necessary to carry out, very urgently, certain works at Bahrain, Sharjah, Dubai, and Kalba. A preliminary reconnaissance has been carried out and certain provisional arrangements made which are outlined in succeeding paragraphs. Your comments on these proposals are requested, and if you approve, may instructions please be issued forthwith to the Political Agents and other authorities concerned so that work can be put in hand at once. 2. BAHRAIN - MUHARAK ISLAND. (i) Diversion of a drainage ditch dividing the civil and R.A.F. landing grounds, and filling of the existing ditch to combine the two grounds. (ii) Construction of S3 reed huts of local pattern, with 6 cook houses of local stone and other minor buildings or camp sites on Muharak. (iii) Construction of earth traverses for bomb stores and certain minor buildings. (iv) Provision of local guards on any R.A.F. stores and bombs located in these areas, and on the new camps if com pleted before occupation by squadrons. My reconnaissance party consulted the Adviser to the Bahrain Government, Mr. C.D. Belgrave, C.B.E., who gave the assistance of his Superintendent of P.W.D., and stated that , if the permission of his Government were obtained officially, all this work could be carried out by his P.W.D., as an Agency service and debit raised in due course. 3. SHARJAH. (i) Extension of the existing aerodrome. (ii) Construction of two camps totalling 66 reed huts and some minor buildings to the east and north of Sharjah fort. (iii) Extension of the R.A.F. bomb store area already existing. (iv) Provision of guards as at Bahrain. The work can be carried out by British Airways once the agreement of the Sheikh has been obtained. 4. DUBAI. Extension of the aerodrome as at Sharjah, and construc tion of a camp of 43 reed huts and minor buildings on the ridge to the West of the aerodrome. Provision of local guards. The work can be carried out by British Airways once the agree ment of the Sheikh has been obtained.An emergency landing ground to be levelled and marked. 6. physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 23; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-22; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence regarding proposals to station a Royal Air Force (RAF) light bomber squadron at Sharjah and a reconnaissance squadron at Dubai. It also discusses works to be undertaken at aerodromes in Bahrain, Sharjah, Dubai, and Kalba. This correspondence has been circulated to government departments by the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. Copies of telegrams dating back to the 22 January 1942 are present in the file.The file includes a divider which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
